question: Outline the general equation for Fischer esterification.

sample_answer.full_answer: Carboxylic acid + alcohol ⇌ ester + water (acid catalyst) (2 marks).

marking_criteria.criteria: States acid + alcohol to ester + water with mention of catalyst/reversibility.

question: Explain why carboxylic acids are stronger acids than alcohols.

sample_answer.full_answer: Carboxylate anion is resonance-stabilised over two oxygen atoms (1 mark). Negative charge in an alkoxide is localised on one oxygen, making it less stable (1 mark). Greater stabilisation lowers pKa, so carboxylic acids are stronger (1 mark).
common_mistakes: Claiming acids are stronger because they have more oxygen without mention of resonance.

question: Determine the mass of sodium hydroxide required to completely saponify 15.0 g of ethyl acetate (molar mass 88.1 g mol^-1).

sample_answer.full_answer: Ester hydrolysis: CH3COOCH2CH3 + NaOH -> CH3COONa + CH3CH2OH (1:1) (1 mark). Moles ester = 15.0 / 88.1 = 0.170 mol (1 mark). Need 0.170 mol NaOH; mass = 0.170 × 40.0 = 6.80 g (2 marks).

question: Compare acid-catalysed and base-catalysed hydrolysis of esters in terms of mechanism and products.

sample_answer.full_answer: Acidic hydrolysis is reversible; protonated carbonyl attacked by water forming acid + alcohol (2 marks). Basic hydrolysis (saponification) proceeds irreversibly via nucleophilic attack by OH-, yielding carboxylate salt + alcohol (2 marks).

marking_criteria.criteria: Describes base mechanism and products / irreversibility.

question: Design a step-wise synthesis to convert benzoic acid into ethyl benzoate and estimate the theoretical yield when starting with 0.250 mol of acid. Include reagents, conditions, and assumptions.

sample_answer.full_answer: Use Fischer esterification: benzoic acid + ethanol with conc. H2SO4 and reflux (2 marks). Remove water to drive equilibrium (Dean-Stark or excess ethanol) (1 mark). Theoretical yield = 0.250 mol ester; mass = 0.250 × 150.17 = 37.5 g (2 marks). Assume complete conversion and no losses in theoretical yield (1 mark).

marking_criteria.criteria: Mentions equilibrium manipulation (excess ethanol/removal of water).

common_mistakes: Omitting catalyst or failing to discuss equilibrium shift.
